content: Great job, you've found a fun way to present the problem and the concept is really interresting!

It seems like a really fun puzzle.

But the test cases are simpler than what could be theoretically expected. They can all be solved by the simplest inference, adding one more completely certain bumbbell at each step, never having to consider multiple variants and backtracking.

This isn't necessarily bad but since it's not obvious from the statement I think it's a bit unfair. Sure, you can figure out that this is the case by implementing it and submitting, but for some OCD types like myself that want to solve stuff with a single submit it just doesn't feel quite right.

Then again I'm not sure how I'd fix this... adding more complicated test-cases may overcomplicate the puzzle too much. Maybe it's ok to assume OCD types like myself are rare enough to ignore.

What a surprise. Yet another CSP from VilBoub.

Ok, fine. The only things that seems strictly lacking are:
  * some kind of note that input is only formed of '.' and 'o' (no '-' or '|')
  * the fact that the solution is only made up of complete dumbbells, no standalone pieces allowed

But then again, I managed to infer.
I'm going on vacation tomorrow, I'll look at it on my return
I know we can make more complicated cases, but I want to make a puzzle that is not too difficult to solve ! (without backtracking)
